Isidore, De natura rerum; De signis caeli; Carmen Sisebuti France, Loire valley (Bischoff) s. IX or s. X

De signis caeli

msItem.author: Isidore
msItem.title: De natura rerum, Cap. 29–47
msItem.incipit: culpam suam admonitus agnoscere mundus. XXX. De fulminibus. Aiunt naturalium scrutatores

msItem.title: De signis coeli [fragment]
msItem.incipit: Helix Arcturus maior. Habet autem in capite stellas obscuras VII
msItem.explicit: Canicula quae oritur post orionem habet stellam splendidam in lingua I, quam syrium et canem
msItem.note: Between cap. VI and VIII on f.4ra–b Carmen Sisebuti.

msItem.title: Carmen Sisebuti
msItem.incipit: Tu forte in luculentus vaga carmina gignis
msItem.explicit: Luna meat fratrem rectis obiectibus argens

supportDesc.foliation: Modern foliation in the upper outher corner of each recto.
supportDesc.collation: Probably the two bifolia from the middle of one quire.

layout.p: Writte in two columns, 260 x 175–180 (column 80–85) mm, 44–45 lines.

provenance.p: Previously belonged probably to Jacques Bongars (1554–1612). The manuscript is however not mentioned in Samuel Hortin's Clavis bibliothecae Bongarsianae from 1634.

history.acquisition: Gift to the Bern Burgerbibliothek by Jakob Graviseth 1632.
